SENT.plain: We describe three patients with primary myelodysplastic syndrome and immunological manifestations
One had painful cutaneous plaques, arthritis and peripheral neuropathy, another showed cutaneous vasculitis, and a third had Sweet's syndrome
All patients responded dramatically to steroids
Before treatment the patient with Sweet's syndrome had high serum levels of interleukin 6 (IL-6), which were reduced to zero after treatment with steroids
Myelodysplastic syndrome should be considered when evaluating patients with immunological or rheumatic manifestations associated with one or more cytopenias
